author: Willy
content: The corridor by the way is only to serve Massachussetts. It isnt to help Maine in any way other than some tax dollars. Tho we could earn greater tax dollars with homes. If anything the corridor will devalue property because no one wants to live close to power poles.

author: Willy
content: Not in this article and some what related. Massachussetts is trying to push a “energy corridor” through Maine. Its under the auspices of bringing jobs to Maine. Yet locals are seeing through the veil of corporate muscle and know that these purported jobs are only temporary. The work will only be there until the job is done. Then a vacuum will occur once the grid is established. Also the jobs offered arent with training. The corporate flex is only seeking experienced help.
